result.execSummary:
The defendant David M Seal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
To be determined by DOC w/n 60 days.  *  PER DOC37  -  RESTITUTION IS SET AT ZERO.
***RESTITUTION ORDERED (DOC-31) RECEIVED ON 4-25-17 SHOWING $327 DUE FOR RESTITUTION

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $ TBD plus surcharges.
*   DOC shall have 60  days to determine restitution.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and sentencing arguments made.    Defendant is sentenced to 10 years in the WSP forthwith; 4 years Initial Confinement followed by 6 years of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 156 days.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Any restitution is to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections within 60 days.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence invesigation ordered.  Sentencing 4/15/16 at 11:00.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial at 03-03-2016 09:20 am
Atty Watson is unavailable for today's hearing.  FPT reset for 3/3/16 at 9:20.

Defendant David M Seal appeared with Attorney Kristyne Alicen Watson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br .  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:50 am.
